step.name: VARYOFF
step.title: Vary Offline
step.description:
Step to Vary a DASD Pack Offline

This step can be used to bring a UCB Off


The step will vary a device offline and check if the device was
successfully brought offline, it will attempt to retry as many
times as defined on the retry limit variable

If you have any questions please reach out to Eduardo Rocha:
Eduardo Rocha @IBM
Eduardo Rocha @LinkedIn
step.instructions:
Step to Vary a DASD Pack Offline

This step can be used to bring a UCB Off


The step will vary a device offline and check if the device was
successfully brought offline, it will attempt to retry as many
times as defined on the retry limit variable

If you have any questions please reach out to Eduardo Rocha:
Eduardo Rocha @IBM
Eduardo Rocha @LinkedIn

template.inlineTemplate:
/*rexx*/ /*retry limit*/ rl=${init-rc} erc=0 /*guarantee uppercase*/ ucb=translate('${init-ucb}') do i=1 to rl call syscmd 'v '||ucb||',offline' if pos('OFFLINE',line.1) > 0 then do erc = 0 say 'DASDINIT01I - UCB OFFLINE' say line.1 leave end else do say 'DASDINIT01W - UCB NOT OFFLINE - RETRYING '||i||' of '||rl erc = 8 end end if erc=8 then say "DASDINIT01E - UCB COULD NOT BE VARIED OFFLINE" exit erc
syscmd: parse arg cmd x=msg('off') 'CONSOLE DEACTIVATE' x=msg('off') 'CONSOLE NAME('SYSVAR(SYSUID)||'@) ACTIVATE' 'CONSOLE SYSCMD('cmd')' msgs = GETMSG('line.','SOL',,,10) 'CONSOLE DEACTIVATE' return

step.name: DASDINIT
step.title: Format/Init DASD Pack
step.description:
Step to INIT / Format a DASD Pack

This step can be used to format a DASD pack


The DASD will be initialized with the default of:

VTOC(0,1,59) and INDEX(4,0,15)

You can edit the JCL to add more devices and change the
defaults if needed.

If you have any questions please reach out to Eduardo Rocha:
Eduardo Rocha @IBM
Eduardo Rocha @LinkedIn
